dmca.title: XYIENCE, INC. TRYING TO WIELD CORPORATE MUSCLE AGAINST ON-LINE INVESTIGATIVE REPORT
dmca.body:
from  "Jamie S. Cogburn" <jsc@cogburnlaw.com>    hide details  Sep 6  
 reply-to  jsc@cogburnlaw.com   
 to  Rich Bergeron <rich.bergeron@gmail.com>   
 date  Sep 6, 2007 3:12 PM   
 subject  Xyience v. Bergeron   
 mailed-by  cogburnlaw.com   

Mr. Bergeron, attached is the orders entered this morning Denying your motion to dismiss and Granting our Injunction.  Pursuant to the Order, please remove all articles making any reference to Xyience defrauding investors and/or being investigated by the SEC.  I expect you will remove these immediately, otherwise we will bring an order to show cause why you should not be held in contempt, wherein we will request attorneys fees and cost, not to mention a request for a Bench Warrant if you continue to disobey the Court's order.
 
I guess that I am not such a bad attorney after all.  I appreciate the books you recommended, but I suggest you read them again.
 
Jamie S. Cogburn
Cogburn Law Offices
170 S. Green Valley Pkwy., Suite 280
Henderson, Nevada 89012
Ph. (702) 384-3616
Fax (702) 943-1936
www.cogburnlaw.com
 
IRS Circular 230 Notice: To ensure compliance with requirements imposed by the IRS, we inform you that any federal tax advice contained in this communication (including any attachments) is not intended or written to be used, and cannot be used, for the purpose of (i) avoiding penalties under the Internal Revenue Code or (ii) promoting, marketing or recommending to another party any transaction or matter addressed herein.

This e-mail transmission, and any documents, files, or previous e-mail messages attached to it may contain confidential information that is legally privileged.  If you are not the intended recipient, or a person responsible for delivering it to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or use of any of the information contained in or attached to this transmission is prohibited.  If you have received this transmission in error, please immediately notify us by reply e-mail, by forwarding this to sender, or by telephone at (702) 384-3616, and destroy the original transmission and its attachments without reading or saving them in any manner.  Thank you.
